entries.meaning: An outside step leading up to the door of a building, usually a home.
examples: Ailie was standing by the doorstep as he came down the road, and her heart stood still with joy.
They want to build the prison right on our doorstep; it will only be half a mile away and being that close scares me.

entries.meaning: (UK, informal) A thick slice, especially of bread.

verbs.description: doorstep (third-person singular simple present doorsteps, present participle doorstepping, simple past and past participle doorstepped)

entries.meaning: (intransitive) To visit one household after another to solicit sales, charitable donations, political support, etc.
(transitive, journalism) To corner somebody for an unexpected interview.
